page.title: 18Harvest customs
page.content: Essentially harvest customs are much the same as they used to be in the way that people like to present things to the church which represent harvest. These are still mainly things grown in their own gardens and fields like veg, fruit etc. but the emphasis has moved away from the corn stocks of old as these are no longer available with combined corn.Even if they no longer attend the local church regulary most residents like to attend the annual harvest service with its cheerful deorations and its familiar hymns. Nearly all the villages also have a harvest supper in conjunction with this festival where the people can meet together over a simple meal provided from the fruits of the earth. After the festival there is a distribution of harvest gifts to the elderly of the area who enjoy them.
